Anies Baswedan Yakin Pembahasan APBD DKI 2020 Tak Terhambat
01 Nov 2019, 12:36 by Imam Hamdi, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan, meyakini pembahasan rancangan APBD DKI 2020 tak akan terhambat meskipun Kepala Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Daerah Sri Mahendra Satria Wirawan dan Kepala Dinas Pariwisata Edi Junaedi mundur. Dia meyakini pengganti Sri Mahendra, Suharti, bisa mengatasi hal itu.
"Beliau (Suharti) mengikuti semua (pembahasan Rancangan APBD 2020)," ujarnya di Balai Kota DKI, Jumat 1 November 2019.
Anies meyakini Suharti yang akan menjabat sebagai Plt Kepala Bappeda DKI bisa menangani pembahasan APBD DKI 2020 karena dia cukup lama bekerja bersama Bappeda. Suharti merupakan Deputi Gubernur Bidang Pengadalian Pendudukan dan Pemukiman.
Soal pengunduran diri Sri Mahendra, Anies mengaku telah bertemu langsung. Meskipun demikian, Anies tak membuka secara jelas alasan pengunduran pria yang baru menjabat sebagai Kepala Bappeda DKI Jakarta sejak Januari 2019 itu.
"Beliau sampaikan bahwa dia (Mahendra) akan aktif di sana dan di sini dia memilih untuk orang lain. saya bilang putusan itu kami hormati Pak Mahendra," ujarnya.
Sementara Edi, Anies mengaku belum bertemu langsung. Menurut Anies, Edi saat ini tengah mengurus orang tuanya yang sakit di luar kota.
"Beliau (Edi) menyerahkan surat pengunduran diri, tapi belum ketemu dan belum ada informasi lebih jauh (terkait keputusannya mengundurkan diri)," kata Anies. "Beliau tidak berada di Jakarta karena mengunjungi ibunya yang sedang sakit. Jadi kebetulan saja waktunya bersamaan."
Sri Mahendra, menurut Anies, nantinya akan menjadi tenaga ahli dalam pendidikan dan pelatihan aparatur sipil negara di Pemprov DKI. Sementara Edi, menurut Kepala Badan Kepegawaian Daerah DKI Chaidir akan menempati posisi staf anjungan di Taman Mini Indonesia Indah atas permintaannya sendiri.
Pengunduran diri kedua pejabat itu terjadi setelah sejumlah anggaran janggal dalam APBD DKI 2020 ramai diperbincangkan. Anggaran tersebut diantaranya adalah penggunaan jasa influencer untuk mempromosikan pariwisata DKI Jakarta sebesar Rp 5 miliar serta anggaran pengadaan lem aibon dan ballpoint senilai masing-masing Rp 82 miliar dan Rp 123 miliar.

Anies Baswedan Believed that the discussion on the 2020 DKI Regional Budget was not hampered
01 Nov 2019, 12:36 by Imam Hamdi, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan, believes the discussion of the DKI 2020 APBD draft will not be hampered even though the Head of the Regional Development Planning Agency Sri Mahendra Satria Wirawan and the Head of the Tourism Office Edi Junaedi resign. He believes that Sri Mahendra's successor, Suharti, can overcome this.
"He (Suharti) followed all (discussion of the 2020 APBD Draft)," he said at the DKI City Hall, Friday 1 November 2019.
Anies believes Suharti, who will serve as Acting Head of DKI Bappeda, can handle the discussion of the 2020 DKI Regional Budget because he has worked with Bappeda for a long time. Suharti is the Deputy Governor for Occupational and Settlement Control.
Regarding Sri Mahendra's resignation, Anies claimed to have met in person. Even so, Anies did not open clearly the reason for the resignation of the man who had just served as the Head of DKI Jakarta Bappeda since January 2019.
"He said that he (Mahendra) would be active there and here he chose for others. I said that we respect Mr. Mahendra's decision," he said.
While Edi, Anies claimed not to meet in person. According to Anies, Edi is currently taking care of his sick parents outside the city.
"He (Edi) submitted a letter of resignation, but has not yet found and there is no further information (related to his decision to resign)," said Anies. "He was not in Jakarta because he visited his mother who was sick. So it just happened to be the same time."
Sri Mahendra, according to Anies, will later become an expert in the education and training of the state civil apparatus in the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government. Meanwhile Edi, according to the Head of the DKI Jakarta Regional Civil Service Agency, Chaidir will occupy the position of the bridge staff at Taman Mini Indonesia Indah at his own request.
The resignation of the two officials occurred after a number of odd budget in the 2020 DKI budget was discussed. The budget includes the use of influencer services to promote tourism in DKI Jakarta in the amount of Rp. 5 billion and the budget for the procurement of aibon glue and ballpoint worth Rp. 82 billion and Rp. 123 billion.
